alert.note: Alert for Newton; Walton (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 10 at 5:54AM EST until further notice by NWS Atlanta
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Peachtree City GA has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Georgia... Alcovy River near Alcovy River above Covington affecting Newton and Walton Counties. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM EARLY THIS MORNING UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring. * WHERE...Alcovy River near Alcovy River above Covington. * WHEN...From early this morning until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 12.0 feet, Flood Stage is reached. Minor flooding begins of woodlands and the natural flood plain of the river upstream and downstream from the gage on Alcovy Trestle Road. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 5:00 AM EST Wednesday the stage was 12.5 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 5:00 AM EST Wednesday was 12.5 feet. - Forecast...No forecast is available for this location. - Flood stage is 12.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 12.9 feet on 02/08/2020. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at weather.gov/atlanta. The next statement will be issued at 300 PM EST.this evening at 600 PM EST.
